column4: Any ideas why my ubuntu won't get assigned an IP until I run vista to get one and run ubuntu again?
I have a homehub and it works perfectly
it used to for me too, until 2 days ago
are you using the network manager applet in the notification area?
copy lines 1 and 2, underneath, then replace "lo" in each of them with "eth0".
finally, "sudo /etc/init.d/networking restart" or reboot etc. and it "should" work
care to explain what the problem was?
well the default ethernet card interface (which i assume is the one you're using) isn't listed in the file that lists what is brought up on boot.
so why did it work before and why infact would it ever work?
the things that could have broken it are the inclusion of an Xbox 360 to the network and my housemate doing some bt talk talk thing.    pebkac?
problem exists between keyboard and computer - ie you must have broken it through your actions incuding sudo/gksudo.
hmm, ok. Oddly enough my dodgy wireless on my laptop has been fine the entire time
that's still listed in the interfaces file ;)
